intro: Benthamidia nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's benthamia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in the summer months. Benthamidia nuttallii is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks.
